question: Which nation houses the active volcano "Pico do Fogo"?
explanation: Pico do Fogo is the highest peak of Cape Verde and West Africa. It is 2829 metres above sea level. It is an active stratovolcano. A stratovolcano, also known as Composite Volcano, is a conical shaped volcano made up of different layers of hardened volcano and ashes. It is the youngest and most active volcano in Cape Verde Islands. The last eruption activity happened in 2014 and it took 77 days to stop the eruption.
